other_tests.findings: High-grade atrioventricular block with sinus rate of approximately 85 beats/min, regular ventricular rate of 75 beats/min, atrioventricular dissociation, abnormal early repolarization, 3-mm coved ST-segment elevation, and biphasic T wave in leads V1 and V2 consistent with type 1 Brugada’s pattern.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Type 1 Brugada’s pattern resolved with continued antibiotic treatment, but a first-degree atrioventricular block remained. Despite treatment, the patient continued to sustain symptomatic complete heart block with intermittent pauses after 1 week. A pacemaker was implanted and later successfully removed after 6 months in the context of normal atrioventricular conduction.
